intro: Calycophysum villosum, commonly known as the hairy calycophyllum, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
